intro: Cubitanthus alatus, commonly known as the winged cubitanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically producing white or pale yellow petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
